meta.title: Privacy-Enhancing Crypto Wallets — Regulatory Risk Dashboard Data
meta.source_deck: 20260216 (DRAFT) Regulatory Risks by Geography and Implications.pptx
notes: This data is a planning input derived from the internal deck. It is not legal advice.
Tier labels (RED/AMBER/GREEN) reflect risk for privacy-asset services and partner availability, not end-user legality.
Update tiers and notes with counsel review before making launch/distribution decisions.

RED.label: Avoid
RED.definition: Assume privacy-asset services are blocked (explicit bans or practical inability to obtain regulated rails).
default_team_guidance: Do not offer privacy-asset services (custody, swap, brokerage, payment facilitation) into these jurisdictions without local counsel approval.
Treat partner availability (banks/PSPs/exchanges) as a hard constraint.

AMBER.label: Caution
AMBER.definition: Non-custodial software is often acceptable, but regulated rails are constrained and partner delistings are likely.
default_team_guidance: Prefer wallet-only posture (non-custodial, no hosted signing).
Expect exchange/fiat partner refusals; design fallbacks.

GREEN.label: Friendlier for non-custodial R&D
GREEN.definition: Clearer rules and no categorical ban identified for non-custodial wallet development; still requires AML/partner diligence.
default_team_guidance: Use as preferred bases for R&D, hiring, and release operations.
Maintain non-custodial guardrails; avoid implying evasion.

jurisdictions.name: United Arab Emirates (UAE)
jurisdictions.risk_summary: Layered restrictions across Dubai (VARA), DIFC (DFSA), and federal payments (CBUAE) with explicit prohibitions for anonymity-enhanced / privacy tokens in regulated contexts.
team_guidance: Avoid locating regulated operations supporting privacy assets (custody/exchange/payment services).
Avoid marketing or distributing privacy-token services into UAE without specific local legal approval.
Assume partners (banks/PSPs/exchanges) will refuse privacy-asset integrations.

jurisdictions.name: Japan
jurisdictions.risk_summary: Registered exchanges have delisted high-anonymity assets under JVCEA/FSA pressure; commercial rails for privacy assets are constrained.
team_guidance: Assume exchange/partner support for privacy assets will be limited or unavailable.
Wallet-only distribution may be possible but partner-dependent features should be treated as incompatible.

jurisdictions.name: South Korea
jurisdictions.risk_summary: VASP regulation forbids transactions with 'dark coins' / privacy coins; licensed partners will not support privacy assets.
team_guidance: Treat as incompatible for custody/exchange roadmap involving privacy assets.
Avoid local-facing marketing or support for privacy-asset services.

jurisdictions.name: Thailand
jurisdictions.risk_summary: Licensed digital asset business operators are prohibited from providing privacy coin services that conceal key transaction data.
team_guidance: Do not build or operate licensed service models involving privacy-coin services in Thailand.
Wallet-only distribution may still face partner and marketing constraints.

jurisdictions.name: European Union (EU)
jurisdictions.risk_summary: EU AMLR restricts anonymous/obfuscated accounts for CASPs; software/self-hosted wallets can be acceptable if the provider has no access/control. Regulated rails are likely to delist/refuse privacy assets.
team_guidance: Keep the wallet strictly non-custodial (no key escrow, no hosted signing).
Avoid EU CASP strategy depending on privacy-coin listings.
Expect friction with banks/PSPs; design fallbacks.

jurisdictions.name: India
jurisdictions.risk_summary: Watch jurisdiction due to likely partner delistings and evolving AML posture toward privacy tokens.
team_guidance: Treat as wallet-only unless counsel confirms otherwise.
Plan for sudden exchange/partner restrictions on privacy assets.

jurisdictions.name: Switzerland
jurisdictions.risk_summary: Comparatively stable, pro-innovation environment for non-custodial software development; no categorical software ban identified in the deck.
team_guidance: Good base for R&D and operations for a non-custodial wallet.
Still perform AML/partner diligence; do not treat as a safe harbor.

jurisdictions.name: United States
jurisdictions.risk_summary: Non-custodial architecture reduces licensing perimeter versus running a hosted service; enforcement risk rises for hosted services and sanctions-sensitive activity.
team_guidance: Keep non-custodial posture; avoid hosted services around privacy assets.
Be conservative around sanctions/compliance sensitive integrations.

jurisdictions.name: Singapore
jurisdictions.risk_summary: Clear licensing frameworks with strict AML/CFT expectations; treat privacy features as higher risk for partners.
team_guidance: Good hub for compliant product teams; maintain conservative posture for retail marketing.
Assume partners may impose extra diligence for privacy assets.

feature_catalog.name: Non-custodial wallet core (user-controlled keys)
feature_catalog.notes: Core design choice that keeps the provider outside custody/service perimeters in many regimes.
recommended_controls: No key escrow; no hosted signing; no recovery custody.
Document threat model: provider has no access/control of funds.

feature_catalog.name: Shielded / privacy-preserving transactions
feature_catalog.notes: High scrutiny feature; restrictions often fall on regulated intermediaries rather than code itself.
recommended_controls: Provide selective disclosure tooling where protocol supports it.

feature_catalog.name: In-app swaps / DEX aggregation
feature_catalog.notes: Often treated as a regulated activity when operated/controlled by the provider or integrated with custodial partners.
recommended_controls: Avoid operating custody or routing as a managed service.

feature_catalog.name: Fiat on/off-ramp integrations
feature_catalog.notes: High partner dependency; many PSPs will refuse privacy-asset flows.
recommended_controls: Separate on-ramp from core wallet; gate by jurisdiction.
Maintain fallback flows that do not require PSP rails where feasible.

feature_catalog.name: Custody (provider holds keys)
feature_catalog.notes: Most likely to trigger licensing and to be prohibited/unsupported for privacy assets in RED jurisdictions.
recommended_controls: Avoid for privacy-asset roadmap; if ever considered, require dedicated counsel review per jurisdiction.

feature_catalog.name: Hosted signing / transaction relay operated by us
feature_catalog.notes: Can be characterized as providing an anonymising service depending on design.
recommended_controls: Avoid; keep signing local on device.

feature_catalog.name: Marketing claims emphasizing anonymity/obfuscation
feature_catalog.notes: Increases scrutiny; avoid framing that implies evasion.
recommended_controls: Message around lawful privacy, safety, and user-controlled disclosure; avoid evasion framing.

feature_catalog.name: Selective disclosure / compliance export tools (user-controlled)
feature_catalog.notes: Helps partners and users demonstrate lawful use while preserving privacy by default.
recommended_controls: Keep disclosures user-initiated and user-controlled; do not collect keys.

guardrails.title: Non-custodial only
guardrails.detail: No key escrow, no hosted signing, no custody, no provider control of user funds.

guardrails.title: Avoid 'privacy-as-a-service' components operated by us
guardrails.detail: Do not operate infrastructure that could be characterized as providing anonymisation as a managed service.

guardrails.title: Geo-gate service features in RED jurisdictions
guardrails.detail: Disable swaps/on-ramps/brokerage-like features in UAE/JP/KR/TH by default; treat AMBER as wallet-only unless counsel approves.

guardrails.title: Plan for partner refusal
guardrails.detail: Assume banks/PSPs/exchanges may refuse privacy-asset integrations; design fallbacks that do not depend on centralized rails.

guardrails.title: Avoid marketing that implies evasion
guardrails.detail: Do not frame privacy features as hiding from law enforcement or sanctions; emphasize lawful privacy.

guardrails.title: Restricted mode for teammates in RED locations
guardrails.detail: Block access to privacy-asset modules, signing keys, release pipelines, and marketing accounts while in RED zones.

internal_processes.name: Feature-to-regulation map
internal_processes.output: A mapping from features to regulatory perimeters and required controls (geo-gating, counsel review, redesign).

internal_processes.name: Launch matrix by jurisdiction
internal_processes.output: Allowed / Restricted / Counsel-required / Do-not-launch matrix for features and distribution channels.

internal_processes.name: Partner strategy reality-check
internal_processes.output: Partner list with confirmed support posture toward privacy assets (where known).

internal_processes.name: Policy monitoring loop
internal_processes.output: Watchlist updates and tier changes (with rationale and sources).

internal_processes.name: Release gate (lightweight)
internal_processes.output: Release approval record (what changed, what jurisdictions affected, any geo-gates updated).

modes.label: Caution mode
modes.description: Wallet-only posture preferred; avoid releases and public marketing without review.

modes.label: Restricted mode
modes.description: No privacy-asset service work; no release keys; escalate.

permission_matrix.RED: No privacy-asset work. No release/keys. Escalate.
permission_matrix.AMBER: R&D ok if non-custodial. No marketing. Legal review.

permission_matrix.RED: Restricted mode. Pause privacy tasks. Avoid demos.
permission_matrix.AMBER: Ok with caution. Avoid releases. Non-sensitive work.

implementation_controls: Repo segmentation: privacy modules behind separate access group.
Release controls: app store submission and signing keys only from GREEN (or pre-cleared AMBER) locations.
Distribution/GTM: geo-fence privacy-asset services in RED; treat AMBER as wallet-only unless counsel approves.
Travel mode: enable restricted mode and revoke sensitive access while in RED zones.

recommendation_rules.title: If service features exist, recommend geo-gating in RED

then.recommendation: Implement/verify jurisdiction gating for service features (swaps/on-ramps) in all RED jurisdictions; document fallback behavior.

recommendation_rules.title: If team members work from RED, recommend restricted mode controls

then.recommendation: Enable restricted mode for the affected teammate(s): revoke release keys, block privacy-module access, pause local-facing demos/support.

recommendation_rules.title: If next review is due soon, recommend running policy review

then.recommendation: Run the quarterly policy monitoring review; confirm tiers and update sources/notes.

recommendation_rules.title: If a partner delists/refuses privacy assets, recommend partner strategy update

then.recommendation: Update the partner strategy reality-check; mark impacted jurisdictions/features and prioritize fallbacks.

recommendation_rules.title: If a jurisdiction tier changes, recommend updating the launch matrix and comms

then.recommendation: Update the launch matrix and guardrails; communicate change to engineering/product/marketing; record decision log entry.

recommendation_rules.title: If primary sources are missing, recommend adding citations/links

then.recommendation: Add primary-source links (rulebooks, regulations, regulator pages) for jurisdictions that are missing them, and record verification dates.
